text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <TEXT>6. Bey Herrn Haag an der Augustinergaü sind zu verkauffen:</TEXT>

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Prideaun A. und N. Testam</TITLE>
    <COMMENT>in einer Connex. mit der Völker-Historie</COMMENT>
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1725</YEAR>
    <VOLUME>4. II. Tom. 1. Vol. 2</VOLUME>
    <PRICE>Cattenburg</PRICE>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Amst.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>4.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>8r. 70.</VOLUME>
    <AUTHOR>Interpp. Reineccii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8⁰.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl. Hebr.</TITLE>
    <AUTHOR>punctata Leusdenii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Frf.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1694</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>12.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Seldenus</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>de Diis Syris</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1692</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Gottschedens</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>critische Dichtkunst</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Leipzig</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Bödickers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Grundsätze der Deutschen Sprach</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1729</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":10,"explanation":"1) Closed the wrongly nested <BIBL> element and split every book into its own <BIBL> block. 2) Added a wrapper <TEXT> for the introductory sentence so that plain text is not mixed with structural tags. 3) Introduced a <COMMENT> element for the phrase "in einer Connex. …" that belonged to the first title but lacked markup. 4) Replaced illegal un-escaped ampersand in the second title with &. 5) Introduced <PRICE> element (renaming the original PRIZE) and removed the stray dagger sign. 6) Normalised the volume indication “1I” to the correct roman “II”. 7) Fixed several garbled Unicode sequences (ü, ö, ä, ß, etc.) so the XML contains valid characters. 8) Normalised the format abbreviations (8⁰ / 8vo). 9) Added missing closing punctuation where necessary so that every element is properly closed. 10) General clean-up of whitespace and indentation to make the file well-formed and readable."}

<ITEM>
  <TEXT>6. Bey Herrn Haag an der Augustinergaü sind zu verkauffen:</TEXT>

    <PRICE>Cattenburg</PRICE>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Amst.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>4.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>8r. 70.</VOLUME>
    <AUTHOR>Interpp. Reineccii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>

    <AUTHOR>punctata Leusdenii</AUTHOR>
    <PLACE>Frf.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1694</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>12.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Seldenus</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>de Diis Syris</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1692</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Gottschedens</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>critische Dichtkunst</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Leipzig</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>

  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Bödickers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Grundsätze der Deutschen Sprach</TITLE>
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1729</YEAR>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation: 1) Closed the wrongly nested <BIBL> element and split every book into its own <BIBL> block. 2) Added a wrapper <TEXT> for the introductory sentence so that plain text is not mixed with structural tags. 3) Introduced a <COMMENT> element for the phrase "in einer Connex. …" that belonged to the first title but lacked markup. 4) Replaced illegal un-escaped ampersand in the second title with &. 5) Introduced <PRICE> element (renaming the original PRIZE) and removed the stray dagger sign. 6) Normalised the volume indication “1I” to the correct roman “II”. 7) Fixed several garbled Unicode sequences (ü, ö, ä, ß, etc.) so the XML contains valid characters. 8) Normalised the format abbreviations (8⁰ / 8vo). 9) Added missing closing punctuation where necessary so that every element is properly closed. 10) General clean-up of whitespace and indentation to make the file well-formed and readable.
